title: Scroll of consecration
data:
| ? [![Scroll.png](/images/8/8d/Scroll.png)](/wiki/File:Scroll.png) |                                                               |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | consecration                                                  |
| Appearance                                                        | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                        | 300 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                            | 5                                                             |
| Ink to write                                                      | [25-49](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker")                    |
| Monster use                                                       | *Will not be used by monsters.*                               |

The **scroll of consecration** is a [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") in [NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation") which also appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [Fourk](/wiki/Fourk "Fourk") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

When read, the scroll attempts to create an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") at your location. How much control you get over its alignment depends on the scroll's [BUC](/wiki/BUC "BUC") status:

| Case     | Effect                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| blessed  | The scroll asks you to select the alignment of the altar to create. This includes the option to create an [unaligned](/wiki/Unaligned "Unaligned") altar dedicated to [Moloch](/wiki/Moloch "Moloch"). |
| uncursed | The scroll creates a co-aligned altar - if you are polymorphed into a [major demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") and read the scroll, the altar will always be chaotic.                            |
| cursed   | The scroll creates an unaligned altar to Moloch.                                                                                                                                                       |

Depending on the alignment of the altar created, you may be rewarded or penalized:

| Alignment     | Effect                                                                                                                                                      |
| ------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| co-aligned    | +1 bonus to [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record"), [prayer timeout](/wiki/Prayer_timeout "Prayer timeout") *reduced* by 1-100 turns |
| cross-aligned | -1 penalty to alignment record, prayer timeout *increased* by 1-100 turns                                                                                   |
| unaligned     | -3 penalty to alignment record, prayer timeout *increased* by 1-300 turns                                                                                   |

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Restrictions](#Restrictions)
- [2 Messages](#Messages)
- [3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
- [4 Fourk](#Fourk)

## Restrictions

Altars cannot be built in [corridors](/wiki/Corridor "Corridor") (where [furniture](/wiki/Furniture "Furniture") will never be found naturally) or on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"). The latter would theoretically permit you to win the endgame without reaching one of the high altars, so appropriately this sort of behavior will incur an [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") penalty.

## Messages

- You feel claustrophobic!

  You read the scroll on a tile ineligible for an altar (specifically a corridor tile).

- You sense the wrath of the gods.

  You read the scroll on the Astral Plane, and incurred an alignment penalty.

- You build an altar.

  You read the scroll successfully.

- Pronouncing arcane formulas, you consecrate the altar to \<deity>.

  Indicates the alignment of the altar.

- You feel comfortable.

  You received a +1 alignment bonus for creating a co-aligned altar.

- You feel uncomfortable.

  You received a -1 alignment penalty for creating a cross-aligned altar.

- You feel very uncomfortable.

  You received a -3 alignment penalty for creating an altar to Moloch.

## dNetHack

The behavior is different in dNetHack: blessed or uncursed scrolls create a coaligned altar, while cursed scrolls create an unaligned altar. If read while confused, applies the consecracted or desecrated oprop to your equipped weapon, based on the scrolls beatitude. If not read on a regular floor square, your god will get angry at you and you won't get the altar. You can't write or wish for scrolls of this type.

- One scroll of consecration is found in [The Temple of Moloch](/wiki/The_Temple_of_Moloch "The Temple of Moloch"), in the treasure chamber on the right.
- Never randomly generated.
- Base price 3000, though this doesn't matter much.

## Fourk

You will find one free copy of this scroll in the [magic chest](/wiki/Magic_chest "Magic chest"). Reading the scroll while confused will generate another magic chest, which is linked to the other magic chests as usual.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
